com.percussion.cms.objectstore
Class PSFolder

java.lang.Object
  com.percussion.cms.objectstore.PSDbComponent
      com.percussion.cms.objectstore.PSFolder
All Implemented Interfaces:
IPSCmsComponent, IPSDbComponent, Serializable, Cloneable
public class PSFolder
extends PSDbComponent
implements Serializable

This class contains all the persistant information for a folder object. However, it does not contain the folder relationship information, which is the information about its related child items or folders.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Field Detail

FOLDER_CONTENT_TYPE_ID

public static final int FOLDER_CONTENT_TYPE_ID
Folders are implemented as a content type. This is the type id. This is public for availability to other parts of the server. It should not be used by anyone else and no assumptions about the implementation should be made as it could change.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

PROPERTY_PUB_FILE_NAME

public static final String PROPERTY_PUB_FILE_NAME
Name of the optional property of a folder that inidcates the file name for publishing. This property is used to override the default name which is folder name used to generate publish location.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

public static final int SYS_FOLDERS_ID
The id of the system folder 'Folders'.

Constructor Detail

PSFolder

public PSFolder(String name,
                int communityId,
                int permissions,
                String description)
Creates a PSFolder instance that is not persisted in the database.

Parameters:
name - The name of the folder. Never null or empty.
communityId - The identifier of a community that have access to this folder, or -1 for all community.
permissions - permissions on the folder encapsulated by this object for the user accessing the folder, should be non-negative. This is a transient data, see getPermissions() for detail.
description - An optional message that describes the folder. May be null or empty.

PSFolder

public PSFolder(PSFolder fromFolder)
Creates an indentical instance from the specified folder object. This does a shallow copy of the key and all data.

Parameters:
fromFolder - the folder object used to construct the new object, must not be null.

PSFolder

public PSFolder(String name,
                int id,
                int communityId,
                int permissions,
                String description)
Creates a PSFolder instance that has persisted in the database.

Parameters:
name - The name of the folder. Never null or empty.
id - The identifier of the folder. It may not be less or equal to 0.
communityId - The identifier of a community that have access to this folder, or -1 for all community.
permissions - permissions on the folder encapsulated by this object for the user accessing the folder, should be non-negative. This is a transient data, see getPermissions() for detail.
description - An optional message that describes the folder. May be null or empty.

PSFolder

public PSFolder(Element source)
         throws com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSUnknownNodeTypeException
Creates an instance from a previously serialized (using toXml ) folder object.

Parameters:
source - A valid element that meets the dtd defined in the description of toXml(Document). Never null.
Throws:
com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSUnknownNodeTypeException - If the supplied source element does not conform to the dtd defined in the fromXml method.
Method Detail

setPersisted

public void setPersisted()
                  throws PSCmsException
Description copied from class: PSDbComponent
See interface for complete description. This class handles the work for the base object only. If the derived class contains other PSDbComponents as members, then it must override this method and call setPersisted on each of its db component members, finally calling this method to handle this instance.

Specified by:
setPersisted in interface IPSDbComponent
Overrides:
setPersisted in class PSDbComponent
Throws:
PSCmsException - If this instance's key does not have an assigned value.

getLocator

public PSLocator getLocator()
Description copied from interface: IPSDbComponent
Gets the key that uniquely identifies this instance. Return of a key does not mean that this instance has been persisted. To make that determination, call PSKey.isPersisted().

Specified by:
getLocator in interface IPSDbComponent
Overrides:
getLocator in class PSDbComponent
Returns:
A key in 1 of 3 states, just the definition (this is what you would get if you instantiated a new instance), assigned but not persisted, or persisted. The returned key is a clone, so changes to it will not affect this object.

getPubFileName

public String getPubFileName()
Gets the publishing filename for the folder. If the folder property named PROPERTY_PUB_FILE_NAME is present, not null or empty, its value will be used as the file name for this folder. If this property is not defined, the folder name is returned.

Returns:
the publishing file name, never null or empty.

getLookupName

protected String getLookupName()
See base class for a description

Overrides:
getLookupName in class PSDbComponent
Returns:
Never null or empty.

createKey

public static PSKey createKey(String[] values)
Creates a key for the object.

Parameters:
values - The values of the to be created key. It may be null. If it is not null, it must contain 2 elemenent. The 1st element is the content id, the 2nd element is the revision number.
Returns:
The created key. It is an empty key if the values is null, otherwise the key is created with the values.

getName

public String getName()
Get the name of the object. The folder name is only unique within amount its siblings.

Returns:
The name supplied in the ctor.

getDescription

public String getDescription()
A short message that describes what this folder is for.

Specified by:
getDescription in interface IPSDbComponent
Overrides:
getDescription in class PSDbComponent
Returns:
The description, may be empty, but never null.

getCommunityId

public int getCommunityId()
Get the community id that has access to this folder object.

Returns:
The community id. If it is -1, then this folder is accessable by all communities.

getLocale

public String getLocale()
Get locale string of the folder.

Returns:
Locale or language string in the standard syntax, e.q. en-us. Never null or empty.

Set method for locale of the folder.

Parameters:
locale - Language string representing the locale for the folder. Must not be null or empty and must be one of the registered locales in the system.

setName

public void setName(String name)
Set a name for the folder object.

Parameters:
name - The to be set name, may not be null or empty.

isRootFolder

public static boolean isRootFolder(int id)
Checks if the specified folder is a root folder or not. Root folders have predefined IDs. ROOT_ID SYS_SITES_ID SYS_FOLDERS_ID

Parameters:
id - the content id of the folder to check
Returns:
true if the specified id matches one of the following: ROOT_ID SYS_SITES_ID SYS_FOLDERS_ID Returns false otherwise.

isRootFolder

public boolean isRootFolder()
Checks if this folder is a root folder or not.

Returns:
true if this folder is a root folder, false otherwise. See isRootFolder(int) for details.

isPublishOnlyInSpecialEdition

public boolean isPublishOnlyInSpecialEdition()
Is this folder marked to be published only for special editions?

Returns:
true if the value of the IPSConstants.SYS_PUBLISH_FOLDER_WITH_SITE property is Boolean.TRUE; false otherwise.

setPublishOnlyInSpecialEdition

public void setPublishOnlyInSpecialEdition(boolean isFolderPublishProperty)
Set the IPSConstants.SYS_PUBLISH_FOLDER_WITH_SITE property according to the supplied property value.

Parameters:
isFolderPublishProperty - true if set the value of the property to Boolean.TRUE; otherwise, delete the property.

getAcl

public PSObjectAcl getAcl()
Returns the ACL set on this folder. This ACL contains zero or more ACL entries. Each ACL entry specifies the level of permission for a particular user, role or virtual entry (Folder Community, Everyone).

Returns:
the ACL set on this folder, never null.

setAcl

public void setAcl(PSObjectAcl acl)
Sets the ACL set on this folder.

Parameters:
acl - the ACL to set on the folder encapsulated by this object, may not be null
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if acl is null
See Also:
getAcl

getPermissions

public PSObjectPermissions getPermissions()
Returns a PSObjectPermissions object which encapsulates an the permissions on this folder for the user accessing the folder.

This is a transient data, and it will not be persisted with the folder object when the folder is saved into the repository.

Returns:
the permissions set on the folder encapsulated by this object, never null

setPermissions

public void setPermissions(PSFolderPermissions permissions)
Sets the specified folder permissions for this object.

This is a transient data, and it will not be persisted with the folder object when the folder is saved into the repository.

Parameters:
permissions - the new folder permissions, never null.

equals

public boolean equals(Object o)
This method has been overriden to also consider the equivilence of the folder's locator as we consider the locator a necessary part of the definition of a folders equivilence. We would not normally consider the locater when determining object equivilence, but folder is a special case.

Specified by:
equals in interface IPSCmsComponent
Specified by:
equals in interface IPSDbComponent
Overrides:
equals in class PSDbComponent
Parameters:
o - the object to check for equivilence against.
Returns:
true if eqivilent.

public int hashCode()

toXml

public Element toXml(Document doc)
Serializes this object into an xml element that can be attached to the supplied document. It will conform to the following dtd: 
 <!ELEMENT PSFolder (PSXLocator, Description, PSXComponentList?)>
 <!ATTLIST PSFolder
    name         CDATA #REQUIRED
    communityId  CDATA #REQUIRED
    >
 <!ELEMENT Description (#PCDATA)>

Specified by:
toXml in interface IPSCmsComponent
Overrides:
toXml in class PSDbComponent
Parameters:
doc - Used to generate the element. Never null.
Returns:
the generated element, never null.

setProperty

public void setProperty(String name,
                        String value,
                        String desc)
Set a property to the folder instance. If the property already exist in the properties list, it will modify the existing one; otherwise, add this property as a new one into the properties list. It searches properties in case insensitive fashion, see getProperty(String).

Parameters:
name - The name of the property, may not be null or empty.
value - The value of the property, may not be null but may be empty.
desc - The description of the property, may be null or empty.

setProperty

public void setProperty(String name,
                        String value)
Just like setProperty, except it set an empty description.

setProperty

public void setProperty(PSFolderProperty property)
Set a property to the folder instance. If the property already exist in the properties list, it will modify the existing one, otherwise it will add this property as a new one into the properties list. It searches properties in case insensitive fashion, see getProperty(String).

Parameters:
property - the folder property, may not be null
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if value is null

setCommunityName

public void setCommunityName(String communityName)
Sets the name of the Community. The name of the community is a transient data, and it will not be persisted with the folder object.

Parameters:
communityName - the new name of the Community, may be null or empty.

getCommunityName

public String getCommunityName()
Gets the name of the Community. The name of the community is a transient data, and it will not be persisted with the folder object. Defaults to null.

Returns:
the name of the Community. It may be null or empty if has not been set by setCommunityName(String) or the community id is -1.

setDisplayFormatName

public void setDisplayFormatName(String displayFormatName)
Sets the name of the display format. The name of the display format is a transient data, and it will not be persisted with the folder object. Defaults to null.

Parameters:
displayFormatName - the new display format name, never null or empty.

getDisplayFormatName

public String getDisplayFormatName()
Gets the name of the display format. The name of the display format is a transient data, and it will not be persisted with the folder object. Defaults to null.

Returns:
the name of the display format. It may be null or empty if has not been set by setDisplayFormatName(String).

setFolderPath

public void setFolderPath(String folderPath)
Sets the folder path. The folder path is a transient data, and will not be persisted with the folder object. Defaults to null.

Parameters:
folderPath - the new folder path, may not be null or empty.

getFolderPath

public String getFolderPath()
Gets the folder path. The folder path is a transient data, and will not be persisted with the folder object. Defaults to null.

Returns:
the folder path, may not be null or empty if has not been set by setFolderPath(String).
